sen.j: 大晦日の夜、二人の男が福の神を祀る神社へ二年参りした。
sen.e: On the night of a New Year's Eve, two men visit a shrine which enshrines Fuku no kami, for Ninen-mairi (visiting a shrine on December 31st and staying there until the New Year's Day comes, thus making the visit spread over the nominal two years.).

sen.j: 鬼は外、福は内と豆を持って囃し立てると、大きな笑い声をあげて福の神が現れる。
sen.e: When they chant loud, "In with good fortune! Out with the demons", throwing beans, Fuku no kami appears with a big laughter.

sen.j: 福の神は「毎年参拝に来るお前達を金持ちにしてやろう。だから酒をくれ」と二人に要求する。
sen.e: Fuku no kami demands sake from the two, saying "Give me sake, and you visiting the shrine every year will be rich."

sen.e: When they offer sake to Fuku no kami, the god starts singing.

sen.j: 金持ちになる秘訣として「早起きをし、他人に優しくし、客を拒まず、夫婦仲良くすることだ」と。
sen.e: He tells them in his song the secret to becoming rich, "Rise early, be kind to others, welcome guests and get along with your wife."
